# **RMSTpowerBoost: Power and Sample Size Calculations for RMST-Based Trials**

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## üîç Overview

As clinical trials and observational studies increasingly move beyond
the restrictive **proportional hazards (PH) assumption**, researchers
need flexible alternatives for analyzing time-to-event data. One such
approach‚Äî**Restricted Mean Survival Time (RMST)**‚Äîhas gained traction
due to its clear clinical interpretation and robustness in non-PH
settings.

Yet, while RMST-based analysis is growing in popularity, tools for
**study design and power calculation** under this framework have lagged
behind.

**`RMSTpowerBoost` bridges that gap**‚Äîoffering a powerful suite of
methods to design, simulate, and plan RMST-based trials, even under
complex censoring mechanisms or nonlinear treatment effects. Whether you
prefer point-and-click simplicity or script-based control,
`RMSTpowerBoost` has you covered.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## ‚ú® Key Features

### ‚úÖ Broad Model Support

Design studies under a range of realistic conditions:

- **Non-Stratified Models**

  - *Linear*: Simple, interpretable modeling.
  - *GAM (Generalized Additive Models)*: Flexible for nonlinear
    covariate effects.

- **Dependent Censoring Models**

  - Account for censoring that‚Äôs related to baseline covariates.

- **Stratified Models**

  - *Additive or Multiplicative*: Ideal for multi-center trials with
    center-specific treatment effects.

### üß† Dual Estimation Methods

For many models, you can choose between:

- **Analytical Approach**: Based on asymptotic variance formulas. Fast
  and efficient for large-scale simulations.
- **Bootstrap-Based Method**: Simulation-driven, providing greater
  robustness, especially in smaller or complex datasets.

### üñ±Ô∏è Interactive Web App

No R experience? No problem. A full-featured **Shiny web application**
is available, making advanced RMST-based design accessible through an
intuitive graphical interface.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## üì¶ Installation

Install the latest development version directly from GitHub:

``` r
# If not already installed
install.packages("remotes")

# Install RMSTpowerBoost
remotes::install_github("UTHSC-Zhang/RMSTpowerBoost-package")
```

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## üåê Try the Shiny App

Explore the tool without writing a single line of code:

üëâ [**Launch the Interactive Web
App**](https://arnab96.shinyapps.io/uthsc-app/)

Perfect for teaching, preliminary analyses, or rapid prototyping.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you need to design a study using RMST, whether for a randomized
trial, observational cohort, or simulation study, `RMSTpowerBoost`
delivers both flexibility and precision‚Äîhelping you move confidently
beyond the hazard ratio.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Package index

## All functions

- [`DC.power.analytical()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/DC.power.analytical.md)
  : Analyze Power for RMST Model with Covariate-Dependent Censoring
  (Analytic)
- [`DC.ss.analytical()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/DC.ss.analytical.md)
  : Find Sample Size for RMST with Covariate-Dependent Censoring
  (Analytic)
- [`GAM.power.boot()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/GAM.power.boot.md)
  : Calculate Power for a Semiparametric Additive RMST Model via
  Simulation
- [`GAM.ss.boot()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/GAM.ss.boot.md)
  : Find Sample Size for a Semiparametric Additive RMST Model via
  Simulation
- [`MS.power.analytical()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/MS.power.analytical.md)
  : Analyze Power for a Multiplicative Stratified RMST Model (Analytic)
- [`MS.power.boot()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/MS.power.boot.md)
  : Analyze Power for a Multiplicative Stratified RMST Model via
  Simulation
- [`MS.ss.analytical()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/MS.ss.analytical.md)
  : Find Sample Size for a Multiplicative Stratified RMST Model
  (Analytic)
- [`MS.ss.boot()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/MS.ss.boot.md)
  : Estimate Sample Size for a Multiplicative Stratified RMST Model via
  Simulation
- [`additive.power.analytical()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/additive.power.analytical.md)
  : Analyze Power for a Stratified Additive RMST Model (Analytic)
- [`additive.ss.analytical()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/additive.ss.analytical.md)
  : Find Sample Size for a Stratified Additive RMST Model (Analytic)
- [`aft_lognormal_L12_n150`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/aft_lognormal_L12_n150.md)
  : Simulated dataset: AFT log-normal, L = 12, n = 150
- [`aft_weibull_L24_n200`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/aft_weibull_L24_n200.md)
  : Simulated dataset: AFT Weibull, L = 24, n = 200
- [`describe_generation()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/describe_generation.md)
  : Summarize a generated dataset and its simulation mechanism
- [`generate_recipe_sets()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/generate_recipe_sets.md)
  : Generate simulated datasets across scenario combinations
  (TXT/CSV/RDS/RData)
- [`linear.power.analytical()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/linear.power.analytical.md)
  : Analyze Power for a Linear RMST Model (Analytic)
- [`linear.power.boot()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/linear.power.boot.md)
  : Analyze Power for a Linear RMST Model via Simulation
- [`linear.ss.analytical()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/linear.ss.analytical.md)
  : Find Sample Size for a Linear RMST Model (Analytic)
- [`linear.ss.boot()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/linear.ss.boot.md)
  : Find Sample Size for a Linear RMST Model via Simulation
- [`load_recipe_sets()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/load_recipe_sets.md)
  : Load datasets from a recipe-sets manifest
- [`ph_pwexp_L18_n250`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/ph_pwexp_L18_n250.md)
  : Simulated dataset: PH piecewise-exponential, L = 18, n = 250
- [`ph_weibull_L24_n300`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/ph_weibull_L24_n300.md)
  : Simulated dataset: PH Weibull, L = 24, n = 300
- [`rebuild_manifest()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/rebuild_manifest.md)
  : Rebuild manifest for an existing output directory (no re-simulation)
- [`recipe_grid()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/recipe_grid.md)
  : Expand a recipe over a grid of values (list-only)
- [`recipe_quick_aft()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/recipe_quick_aft.md)
  : Quick AFT recipe builder (list-only, no L/tau)
- [`rmst_pwexp_strat_300`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/rmst_pwexp_strat_300.md)
  : Example dataset: stratified PH piecewise-exponential (n = 300)
- [`rmst_small_50`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/rmst_small_50.md)
  : Example dataset: small study (n = 50)
- [`run_app()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/run_app.md)
  : Launch the RMSTdesign Shiny Application
- [`simulate_from_recipe()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/simulate_from_recipe.md)
  : Simulate a dataset from a validated recipe (list-only)
- [`validate_recipe()`](https://uthsc-zhang.github.io/RMSTpowerBoost-Package/reference/validate_recipe.md)
  : Validate a simulation recipe (list-only schema)
